intro: Stypandra scoparia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stypandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It is a perennial shrub that produces small, edible fruits, which are important for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
